newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian cotton prices extend gains on overseas bids.
newsitem.headline: Indian cotton prices extend gains on overseas bids.

text.p: Indian cotton prices extended gains on Tuesday on fresh overseas interest and thin supplies, dealers said.
New crop arrivals at producing centres including northern and western India remained low due to severe cold weather as well as offseason rains.

In the spot deals Bengal-deshi rose by five rupees to 840/870 rupees per maund (37.32 kg) while Punjab saw-ginned moved up by 10 rupees to 1,425/1,650 rupees per maund. F-414 rose by 10/35 rupees to 1,875/1,880 rupees per maund.

Gujarat and Madhya Pradesh varieties however moved in a narrow range and settled on a steady note. Gujarat Sankar-4 was unchanged at 18,500/19,000 rupees per candy (355.56 kg) for the superior variety. -- Bombay Commodities +91-22-265 9000
